nodes.bodyText:
There are several places that assume they will always get count from this, the MAXINT variant return being rare.
Specifically, the AbstractBuildingWorker and the Dyer both use this function to figure out which ingredient is in largest supply.  Do we actually need the MAXINT result?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -720,19 +720,9 @@ public static int getItemCountInProvider(@NotNull final ICapabilityProvider prov
     public static int hasBuildingEnoughElseCount(@NotNull final IBuilding provider, @NotNull final ItemStorage stack, final int count)

nodes.bodyText: This method is kinda greedy, meaning that the moment we found enough we return. Thus, the returned count != the actually available count but just > the input count. Thus, if return is maxInt we know we got enough, else we know we got just as much as the return value specifies.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -720,19 +720,9 @@ public static int getItemCountInProvider(@NotNull final ICapabilityProvider prov
     public static int hasBuildingEnoughElseCount(@NotNull final IBuilding provider, @NotNull final ItemStorage stack, final int count)

nodes.bodyText: I'm wondering if we maybe want to sort by creative tab first and then by tag?
I wanted to get rid of the creative tab searching because a lot of that info is client-side only and not "very" reliable.
function name and doc don't match up

nodes.bodyText: think you need to exclude the warehouse hutblock here?
The warehouse block is also a valid chest to drop off
thought we are not using it, but ok
